title: Cannot approve on iPhone 15
text: Since I upgraded my phone, the app no longer pops open for me to enter the codes shown on other devices when I need to log in. When I open the app manually for that purpose, there is no place to enter a code. If I try to open emails or log into work from my phone, the app opens automatically and tells me ‚Äúopen the Authenticator app to enter this code‚Äù ‚Ä¶ but it is open. I am IN the app getting that message. And there is nowhere within the app to enter the code!!! I cannot log into work at all now unless I‚Äôm there on their devices. So I am not getting urgent emails and cannot help with saved documents. It worked perfectly on my old phone.

title: Extremely unnecessary and bad use interface

title: Why is this app necessary?
text:
With the existence of two factor authentication, why is this app at all necessary? There is no reason one should need two apps to access one app, none.

Also, it needs two security checks (one to open the app, and one after you‚Äôve entered the code) to open an email. Why is this necessary, when they are the exact same check?

There really is nothing to like about this‚Äîit doesn‚Äôt do anything except provide annoyance and consume memory storage

title: Cannot Transfer App to New Phone

title: Needs cross-device synchronization
text:
With Google Authenticator or Authy, my 2FA accounts are synchronized to all my devices.  I can see the same accounts on both my Android phone and iPhone. 

I can add a new account on my iPhone, and it will show up in the Google authenticator app on my Android phone. And vice versa. 

When I discovered these options with the other apps, I ditched Microsoft authenticator, though I would like to have it on this app which I still have to hold onto it for my Microsoft accounts.

title: Phuk this stupid app

title: App isn‚Äôt smart enough to allow duplicate entries with the same email address
text:
I have a lot of MFA tokens to work with all of the vendors and so my work email is used in many portals now 

I have to use two apps now because this Microsoft one isn‚Äôt smart enough to allow multiple entries with the same email address 

The fix is simple, is to not use the email address as the keyfield when generating a new MFA entry 

This is a massive problem and it needs to be fixed

title: Pretty Busted
text:
Whenever I open the app it tells me that my backups are out of date and I need to sign back into my account.

Cool.

So I tap on sign in. It errors immediately and offers to let me send my logs to MS to report the issue.

Cool.

I write up a description of the issue and attach the logs and hit the submit button.

A loading indicator pops up that tells me its sending and 15 minutes later it is still spinning.

I kill the app.

Even the tool to report the issues is broken üíÄ

title: Privacy issues
text: This app tracks your location even if you turn off the location permission on your phone to this app. Beware that you can be located when this app is on your phone.  And since it runs in the background with no way to disable that you will always be watched.
